tweets.text: @CRTContactUs @Feargal_Sharkey @MonkeyTennis14 @ben_watt @NaturalEngland @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 @CanalRiverTrust Hi @CRTContactUs @CRTSouthEast  and @Feargal_Sharkey we have volunteer pick ups along the banks planned for the next few weekends but urgently need the rubbish removed from the water and traps - if we work together over the next few weeks while water is low a lot can be achieved

There is a lot of water in the drains, watercourses and lagoons at the moment, but Hull City Council and our @LivingWithH2O partners @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater and @ERfloodrisk are aware and are working together around the clock to try and keep the water where it belongs! https://t.co/KjDZq6iQlY

A fishing licence is more than a permit. It funds the protection of England‚Äôs precious waterways, securing a sustainable future for fish and anglers alike.

Find out more about how licence money is spent in our Annual Fisheries Report: https://t.co/nNLzDIjKCP https://t.co/Pg7VzrblWE

Human impact is threatening our ocean.

Join our Ocean Recovery Conference to learn about the issues facing the coastal and marine community and the actions needed for ocean recovery.

Find out more: https://t.co/C3b5a0ikug
 
#CoastalFutures21 | @wwf_uk https://t.co/eOK6JZXOby

@MuseumOfCroydon @EnvAgency @HistoricEngland @MOLArchaeology Thanks. I was looking through the @HistoricEngland  website last night but could not find the right place. Although my thinking might sound unlikely, I have read a good deal of local history and never heard of any reference to this location.

A new replacement gate is being air-lifted into place at the Foss Barrier in #York next week as part of a ¬£38m upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to around 1,200 properties https://t.co/i7onQwWAZx

Our Mark Fuller explains how this will be carried out @CityofYork https://t.co/n96OREfxrx

tweets.text: @RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot I've been to some of the leaking coastal landfills with @DrKateSpencer that she's been investigating. tweets.text: @MonkeyTennis14 @ben_watt @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 I'm familiar with Brent Reservoir. It's fed by Silk Stream and River Brent, both fairly sick little rivers, they're really just drainage ditches for large parts of north London. If I remember the reservoir is owned by the @CanalRiverTrust and used to top up the Grand Union Canal.

tweets.text: @Kingston22W @kernowbeaver @BeaverTrust @TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @EnvAgency No Mr. Kingston, of course nothing is the *only* answer but they can, if properly managed, be part of the solution. One of the best projects I secured funding for back in @EnvAgency days was the establishment of the 
@savebutterflies National #Moth Recording Database in 2006. Now >25M records and a wealth of data showing trends due to climate and habitat changes etc. See Dec @britwildlife https://t.co/v2iqfwEjUs
